On a failed save the creature is charmed by the sarlacc for 1 minute. While charmed this way, the target tries to get as close to the sarlacc as possible, using its actions to Dash until it is within 5 feet of the sarlacc. A charmed target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns and whenever it takes damage, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature has advantage on saving throws against the sarlacc's Pheromones for 24 hours.

id-00001.name: Options
id-00001.desc: The sarlacc can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The sarlacc regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

id-00002.name: Earth-Shaking Movement
id-00002.desc: The sarlacc sends a shockwave through the ground in a 120-foot-radius circle centered on itself. That area becomes difficult terrain for 1 round.\rEach creature on the ground in the area must succeed on a DC 22 Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 41 (6d10 + 8) sonic damage and is knocked prone on a failed save, or half as much damage and is not knocked prone on a successful one. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more is pulled 15 feet downwards and towards the sarlacc.

id-00003.name: Reel
id-00003.desc: The sarlacc pulls each creature grappled by it up to 30 feet straight towards it.

id-00004.name: Tentacle
id-00004.desc: The sarlacc makes one tentacle attack.

id-00005.name: Chomp (Costs 2 Actions)
id-00005.desc: The sarlacc makes one bite attack or uses its swallow.

id-00001.name: Ambusher
id-00001.desc: In the first round of a combat, the scrange has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it surprised.

id-00002.name: Bioluminescent
id-00002.desc: The scrange either emits dim light in a 10foot radius, or bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 ft.. It can switch between the options as a bonus action.

id-00003.name: Mud Camouflage
id-00003.desc: The scrange has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in muddy terrain.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The scrange makes two attacks. one with its bite and one with its tail. It can't make both attacks against the same target.

id-00002.name: Bite
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d10 + 6) kinetic damage.

id-00003.name: Tail
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (4d10 + 6) kinetic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

id-00001.name: Keen Smell
id-00001.desc: The scurrier has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

id-00002.name: Pack Tactics
id-00002.desc: The scurrier has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the scurrier's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

id-00001.name: Bite
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) kinetic damage.

id-00002.name: Ram
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 2) kinetic damage.

id-00001.name: Circuitry
id-00001.desc: The construct has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal ion or lightning damage.

id-00002.name: Droid Encasement
id-00002.desc: The Dashta Eel within the machine is a somewhat shapeless mass. When the JK-13 Security Droid is reduced to 0 hp, the droid armor breaks and the Dashta Eel exits it. Once out of its armor, the creature's pulpy mass no longer receives the benefits of the listed Damage Resistances.\rWithout its armor, the Dashta Eel has the following statistics. AC 12, hp 19 (3d8 + 6), Strength 8 (-1), and its speed becomes 15 feet. In addition, it has no attack actions.

id-00003.name: Jedi Slayer
id-00003.desc: JK-13 Security Droid has advantage on saving throws versus force powers used by creatures within 5 feet of it. When an enemy within 5 feet uses a force power, JK-13 Security Droid can make a melee attack against that character as a reaction. When JK-13 Security Droid damages an enemy, they have disadvantage on concentration saving throws to maintain their force powers.

id-00001.name: Deflector Shield
id-00001.desc: The JK-13 Security Droid adds 3 to its AC against one attack that would hit it. To do so, the droid must see the attacker.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The JK-13 Security Droid makes any combination of three Slicing Tentacle attacks and Stunning Tentacle attacks.

id-00002.name: Stunning Tentacle
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (3d4 +4) kinetic damage and the target must succeed on a Constitution save (DC 17) or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

id-00003.name: Slicing Tentacle
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 +5) kinetic damage.

id-00001.name: Heavy Pistol
id-00001.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4, range 40/160, one target. Hit: 6 (1d8+2) energy damage.

id-00002.name: Vibrobaton
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 6 (2d4+2) kinetic damage.

id-00001.name: Ram
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) kinetic damage.

id-00001.name: Blood Drain
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) kinetic damage, and the sketto attaches to the target. While attached, the sketto doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the sketto's turns, the target loses 5 (1d4 + 3) hit points due to blood loss. Droids and constructs are immune to this effect.\rThe sketto can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. It does so after it drains 10 hit points of blood from the target or the target dies. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the sketto.

id-00001.name: Bioluminescent
id-00001.desc: The sloth emits bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 ft..

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The sloth makes two fist attacks.

id-00002.name: Fist
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) kinetic damage.

id-00003.name: Fling Mud
id-00003.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 25/50 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) kinetic damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is must also make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it is also blinded until the end of its next turn.

id-00001.name: Iron Scent
id-00001.desc: The steelpecker can pinpoint, by scent, the location of metal within 30 feet of it.

id-00002.name: Keen Sight And Smell
id-00002.desc: The steelpecker has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

id-00001.name: Beak
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) kinetic damage. The steelpecker devours any unenhanced metal object it attacks. If the object isn't being worn or carried, the attack destroys a 1-inch cube of it.\rIf the object attacked is either metal armor or a metal shield being worn or carried, its takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed. If the object attacked is a held metal weapon, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed.

id-00001.name: Keen Smell
id-00001.desc: The stintaril has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

id-00002.name: Pack Tactics
id-00002.desc: The stintaril has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the stintaril's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

id-00001.name: Bite
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +0 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) kinetic damage.

stintarilswarm.name: Stintaril Swarm
stintarilswarm.conditionimmunities: charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

id-00001.name: Swarm
id-00001.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny stintarils. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

id-00002.name: Keen Smell
id-00002.desc: The swarm has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and smell.

id-00001.name: Bites
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target in the swarm's space. Hit: 7 (2d6) kinetic damage, or 3 (1d6) kinetic damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

steep.name: Steep
steep.damageresistances: energy, ion, kinetic from nonmagical weapons

id-00001.name: Amphibious
id-00001.desc: The steep can breathe air and water.

id-00002.name: Reckless
id-00002.desc: At the start of its turn, the steep can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

id-00001.name: Bite
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d8 + 2) kinetic damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the steep can't bite another target.

swampslug.name: Swamp Slug
swampslug.damageresistances: energy, ion, kinetic from nonmagical weapons
swampslug.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 16

id-00001.name: Vile Stench
id-00001.desc: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the slug must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 9 (2d8) poison damage.

id-00002.name: Hold Breath
id-00002.desc: The slug can hold its breath for 1 hour.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The slug makes one bite attack and one slam attack.

id-00002.name: Bite
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) kinetic damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 18). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the slug can't bite another target.

id-00003.name: Slam
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) kinetic damage.

id-00004.name: Swallow
id-00004.desc: The slug makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the slug, and it takes 7 (2d6) kinetic damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage at the start of each of the slug's turns. The slug can have only one target swallowed at a time.\rIf the slug dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting prone.

supertacticaldroid.name: Super Tactical Droid
supertacticaldroid.conditionimmunities: blinded, charmed, deafened, exhaustion, frightened, poisoned

id-00001.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
id-00001.desc: If the tactical droid fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

id-00002.name: Master Of The Droid
id-00002.desc: While within 30 feet of the tactical droid, any droid ally of the tactical droid makes saving throws with advantage, and that ally regains 1d6 hit points whenever it starts its turn there.

id-00003.name: Circuitry
id-00003.desc: The tactical droid has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal ion or lightning damage.

id-00004.name: Tactical Technology
id-00004.desc: When the tactical droid casts a tech power that causes damage or that forces other creatures to make a saving throw, it can choose itself and any number of allies to be immune to the damage caused by the power and to succeed on the required saving throw.

id-00005.name: Spellcasting
id-00005.desc: The super tactical droid is a 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). The droid has 57 tech points. The super tactical droid has the following spells prepared:\rCantrips (At will): assess the situation, encrypted message, electroshock, poison spray, cryogenic burst, combustive shot\r1st level (57 slots): homing rockets, expeditious retreat, repair droid\r2nd level (57 slots): mirror image, capacity boost\r3rd level (57 slots): explosion, tactical advantage\r4th level (57 slots): sensor probe, synchronicity\r5th level (57 slots): mass repair droid, toxic cloud\r6th level (57 slots): security protocols\r7th level (57 slots): tactical superiority

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The tactical droid makes three biopistol attacks.

id-00002.name: Biopistol
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Ateack. +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) kinetic damage plus 14 (4d6) poison damage.

id-00001.name: Options
id-00001.desc: The tactical droid can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The tactical droid regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

id-00002.name: Biopistol
id-00002.desc: The tactical droid makes a biopistol attack.

id-00003.name: At-Will
id-00003.desc: The tactical droid casts an at-will tech power.

id-00004.name: Move
id-00004.desc: The tactical droid moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

id-00005.name: Construct Droid (Costs 3 Actions)
id-00005.desc: Up to five junk droids appear in unoccupied spaces within 30 feet of the tactical droid and remain until destroyed. Droids summoned in this way roll initiative and act in the next available turn. The tactical droid can have up to five droids summoned by this ability at a time.

t_seriestacticaldroid.name: T-series Tactical Droid
t_seriestacticaldroid.languages: Galactic Basic, Binary, and two others

id-00001.name: Circuitry
id-00001.desc: The droid has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal ion or lightning damage.

id-00002.name: Preditctive Ai
id-00002.desc: The tactical droid can enter a state of higher programming as an action. While concentrating, the droid can't be surprised and has advantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. Additionally, other creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target. This lasts for 1 hour.

id-00003.name: Innate Spellcasting
id-00003.desc: The t-series tactical droid's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 14, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:\rAt will: Assess the Situation, Encrypted Message, On/Off, Alarm, Element of Surprise\r3/day each: Repair Droid, Stack the Deck

id-00001.name: Blaster pistol
id-00001.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, Ammunition (range40/160), one target. Hit 5 (1d6 + 2) energy damage.

id-00001.name: Circuitry
id-00001.desc: The droid has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal ion or lightning damage.

id-00002.name: Spellcasting
id-00002.desc: The t3-series utility droid is a 2nd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The droid has 10 tech points. The t3-series utility droid has the following spells prepared:\rCantrips (At will): electroshock, encrypted message, mending, on/off\r1st level (10 slots): decryption program, energy shield, holographic disguise, repair droid, tracer bolt

id-00001.name: Hold-Out
id-00001.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +2 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) energy damage.

terentatek.name: Terentatek
terentatek.languages: Can't speak but understands commands in Sith

id-00001.name: Force Resistance
id-00001.desc: The terentatek has advantage on saving throws against force powers and resistance to damage dealt by force powers.

id-00002.name: Sith-born
id-00002.desc: Dark forcecasters and Sith (species) have advantage on Animal Handling checks on Terentatek.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The Terentatek makes three attacks, once with its tusks and twice with its claws.

id-00002.name: Tusks
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 22 (5d8+3) kinetic damage. The creature must then succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 15) or become poisoned and take 2 (1d4) toxin damage per turn.

id-00003.name: Claws
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 18 (5d6+3) kinetic damage. The creature must then succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 15) or become poisoned and take 2 (1d4) toxin damage per turn.

id-00004.name: Rock
id-00004.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 30/70 ft., one creature. Hit: 15 (4d6+3) kinetic damage.

trandoshanhuntmaster.name: Trandoshan Huntmaster
trandoshanhuntmaster.skills: Athletics +7, Intimidation +5, Perception +6, Persuasion +5, Stealth +6, Survival +6

id-00001.name: Infrared Vision
id-00001.desc: The trandoshan has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

id-00002.name: Regeneration
id-00002.desc: The trandoshan regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

id-00003.name: Martial Advantage
id-00003.desc: Once per turn, the trandoshan can deal an extra 14 (4d6) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the trandoshan that isn't incapacitated.

id-00001.name: Parry
id-00001.desc: The trandoshan adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the trandoshan must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The trandoshan makes three melee weapon attacks. Alternatively, it can make two ranged attacks with its javelin.

id-00002.name: Trandoshan Sword
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) kinetic damage, or 9 (1d10 + 4) kinetic damage if used with two hands.

id-00003.name: Javelin
id-00003.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) kinetic damage.

id-00004.name: Shield Bash
id-00004.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d4 + 4) kinetic damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

id-00005.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
id-00005.desc: For 1 minute, the trandoshan can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a d4 to its roll provided it can hear and understand the trandoshan. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time.\rThis effect ends if the warlord is incapacitated.

id-00001.name: Infrared Vision
id-00001.desc: The trandoshan has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

id-00002.name: Regeneration
id-00002.desc: The trandoshan regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

id-00003.name: Double Weapon
id-00003.desc: When the trandoshan attacks uses its multiattack, it can use a bonus action to make another attack. The trandoshans doesn't add its ability modifier to the damage of this attack.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The trandoshan makes two weapon attacks.

id-00002.name: Trandoshan Double-Sword
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) kinetic damage.

id-00003.name: Trandoshan Double-Sword (Bonus Action Attack)
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d8) kinetic damage.

id-00001.name: Trandoshan Double-Sword (Bonus Action Attack)
id-00001.desc: Hunter's Eye (3/Day). As a bonus, the tradoshan can add 1d10 to its next attack or damage roll with a blaster weapon.

id-00002.name: Infrared Vision
id-00002.desc: The trandoshan has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

id-00003.name: Regeneration
id-00003.desc: The trandoshan regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The trandoshan makes two ranged weapon attacks.

id-00002.name: Blaster Rifle
id-00002.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) energy damage.

id-00003.name: Trandoshan Shortsword
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) kinetic damage.

id-00001.name: Brute
id-00001.desc: The trandoshan deals an extra 3 (1d6) damage when it hits with a melee weapon attack (included in the attacks).

id-00002.name: Frenzy
id-00002.desc: When the trandoshan reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, it can immediately move up to half its speed and make a vibrosword attack.

id-00003.name: Infrared Vision
id-00003.desc: The trandoshan has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

id-00004.name: Regeneration
id-00004.desc: The trandoshan regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

id-00001.name: Parry
id-00001.desc: The trandoshan adds 3 to his AC against one melee attack that would hit him. To do so, the trandoshan must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The trandoshan makes three attacks with its sword or slugthrower.

id-00002.name: Trandoshan Greatsword
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d6 + 4) kinetic damage.

id-00003.name: Slugthrower
id-00003.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 100/400., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) kinetic damage.

id-00004.name: Burst
id-00004.desc: The trandoshan sprays a 10-foot-cube area within normal range with shots. Each creature in the area must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 (1d8 + 3) kinetic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

trooper_mounted.name: Trooper, Mounted
trooper_mounted.languages: Galactic Basic, one other of your choice

id-00001.name: Charge
id-00001.desc: If the mounted trooper moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature while mounted and then hits with a vibrolance attack on the same turn, it can make a trample attack against the creature as a bonus action.

id-00002.name: Locked Saddle
id-00002.desc: The trooper cannot be knocked prone, dismounted, or moved against it's will while mounted.

id-00003.name: Mounted Warrior
id-00003.desc: While the trooper is mounted, the mount cannot be charmed or frightened.

id-00001.name: Vibrolance
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d12 + 2) kinetic damage.

id-00002.name: Assault Cannon
id-00002.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack. +3 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d10 + 1) energy damage.

id-00003.name: Trample (Mounted Only)
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) kinetic damage and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

id-00004.name: Flamethrower (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
id-00004.desc: The trooper unleashes a torrent of flame in a 15-ft. cone. All creatures in that area must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trooper_purge.name: Trooper, Purge
trooper_purge.languages: Galactic Basic, one other of your choice

id-00001.name: Jedi Hunter
id-00001.desc: The trooper has advantage on Wisdom (survival) checks to track humanoids that can cast force powers and on Intelligence (lore) checks to recall information about Jedi and the Force.

id-00002.name: Force Combat Training
id-00002.desc: The trooper has advantage on saving throws against Force powers.

id-00003.name: Surprise Attack
id-00003.desc: If the trooper surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) damage from the attack.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The trooper makes two melee or three ranged attacks.

id-00002.name: Blaster Rifle
id-00002.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) energy damage.

id-00003.name: Electrostaff
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) kinetic damage.

id-00004.name: Volley (Recharge 6)
id-00004.desc: The trooper makes one ranged attack against every enemy within 10 feet of a point it can see.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The trooper makes two blaster rifle or stock strike attacks.

id-00002.name: Blaster Rifle
id-00002.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 3) energy damage.

id-00003.name: Stock Strike
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) kinetic damage.

id-00004.name: Thermal Grenade (1/Day)
id-00004.desc: The captain throws a grenade, choosing a point within 40 ft. Each creature within 10 feet must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 2d6 fire and 2d6 kinetic damage on a failed save, or half as much as on a successful one.\rAdditionally, on a failed save, the creature is knocked prone.

id-00001.name: Keen Hearing And Sight
id-00001.desc: The scout trooper has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

id-00001.name: Sniper Rifle
id-00001.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 150/600, one target. Hit: 8 (1d12+2).

id-00002.name: Vibrodagger
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4+2)

id-00001.name: Keen Senses
id-00001.desc: The Tuk'ata has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks.

id-00002.name: Sith-born
id-00002.desc: Dark forcecasters and Sith (species) have advantage on Animal Handling checks against Tuk'ata.

id-00003.name: Telepathy
id-00003.desc: Tuk'ata can communicate telepathically with other creature within it's line of sight.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The Tuk'ata makes two attacks, once with its bite and once with its claws or poisonous stingers.

id-00002.name: Bite
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d8+3) kinetic damage.

id-00003.name: Claws
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) kinetic damage.

id-00004.name: Poisonous Stingers
id-00004.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4+3) kinetic damage.\rThe creature must then succeed on a Constitution saving throw (DC 13) or become poisoned.

id-00001.name: Keen Sight And Smell
id-00001.desc: The tusk cat has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and smell.

id-00002.name: Trampling Charge
id-00002.desc: If the tusk cat moves at least 20 ft.\rstraight toward a creature and then hits it with a tusk attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the tusk cat can make one hooves attack against it as a bonus action.

id-00001.name: Hooves
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) kinetic damage.

id-00002.name: Tusks
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) kinetic damage.

id-00001.name: Dive Attack
id-00001.desc: If the twirrl is flying and dives at least 30 ft.\rstraight toward a target and then hits it with a talon attack, the attack deals an extra 2 (1d4) damage to the target.

id-00002.name: Keen Sight
id-00002.desc: The twirrl has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

id-00001.name: Talons
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) kinetic damage.

tx_225aoccupiertank.name: TX-225A Occupier Tank
tx_225aoccupiertank.conditionimmunities: blinded, charmed, frightened, incapacitated, petrified, poisoned, diseased, prone, restrained, stunned

id-00001.name: Circuitry
id-00001.desc: The tank has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal ion or lightning damage.

id-00002.name: Heavy Durasteel Armor
id-00002.desc: The outer layer of the tank is covered in heavy armor, making it difficult for smaller arms to damage it. Unless the damage from a single attack or effect exceeds 15 points, the tank takes no damage from that attack. If the tank takes an amount of damage from a single attack or effect equal to or greater than its damage threshold, it takes damage as normal.

id-00003.name: Piloted
id-00003.desc: The tank requires an active pilot to take any actions, and if the pilot is subjected to any conditions that the construct is not immune to, the construct is also subjected to those conditions. The pilot may take their own action or one of the actions granted by the construct.

id-00004.name: Vulnerable Interior
id-00004.desc: The tank's interior is vulnerable to damage done by grenades, mines and charges, unless it is immune to that damage. It also automatically fails all Dexterity saving throws from such effects that occur in its interior.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The tank makes two laser cannon attacks.

id-00002.name: Laser Cannon
id-00002.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack +7 to hit, 100/400, one target. Hit 15 (2d10 + 4) energy damage.

id-00003.name: Blaster Cannon Volley (Recharge 5-6)
id-00003.desc: the tank launches a barrage of cannon fire at a point within 120 feet. Each creature within 20 feet of that point must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) energy damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

id-00004.name: Frightful Presence
id-00004.desc: Each creature of the tank's choice that is within 80 feet of the tank and aware of it must succeed on a DC 12 Wisdom saving throw or become frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the tank's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

veermok.name: Veermok
veermok.damageresistances: energy, ion, kinetic from nonmagical weapons

id-00001.name: Multiattack The veermok makes three attacks
id-00001.desc: one with its bite and two with its fists.

id-00002.name: Bite
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) kinetic damage.

id-00003.name: Claw
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) kinetic damage.

id-00004.name: Rock
id-00004.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 25/50 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) kinetic damage.

vesuvaguetree.name: Vesuvague Tree
vesuvaguetree.languages: Basic, any one other of your choice

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The vesuvague tree may make two constrict attacks per turn.

id-00002.name: Constrict
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit 11 (1d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage, and a Large or smaller target is grappled (escape DC 16).

id-00001.name: Force Tracking
id-00001.desc: The vornskr can sense the presence of force creatures and objects up to 1 mile away. It knows the general direction they're in but not their exact locations.

id-00002.name: Keen Smell
id-00002.desc: The vornskr has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

id-00001.name: Bite
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) kinetic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

id-00002.name: Tail
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) kinetic damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage. If the target is a creature it must also make DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature is paralyzed for 1 minute. The creature can repeat this saving throw at end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself.

id-00001.name: Vacuum Cocoon
id-00001.desc: The Voxyn are able to create Cocoon's\rthat will allow them to survive the vacuum of space

id-00002.name: Keen Smell
id-00002.desc: The Voxyn has advantage on Wisdom\r(Perception) checks that rely on smell.

id-00003.name: Force Tracking
id-00003.desc: The Voxyn can sense the presence of force\rcreatures and objects up to 1 mile away. It knows the\rgeneral direction they're in but not their exact locations.

id-00004.name: Unstable Clone Biology
id-00004.desc: The Voxyn's cells rapidly deteriorate\rafter creation, the Voxyn lifespan usually only last a few\rmonths after creation

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: Voxyn can make two bite attacks and one tail attack.

id-00002.name: Bite
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d8 + 5) kinetic damage & 12 (2d12) acid damage If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

id-00003.name: Tail
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 5) kinetic damage plus 18 (6d6) poison damage. If the target is a creature it must also make DC 16 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature is paralyzed for 1 minute. The creature can repeat this saving throw at end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself.

id-00004.name: Sonic Blast (Recharge 5-6)
id-00004.desc: The Voxyn emits a sonic howl from its snout. Creatures within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or take 32 (5d10 + 5) Sonic damage, be stunned for 1 minute, and is deafened. Takes half damage on a successful save. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

id-00001.name: Keen Sight And Smell
id-00001.desc: The vulptex has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

id-00001.name: Claws
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) kinetic damage.

warwyrm.name: War Wyrm
warwyrm.senses: blindsight 30 ft., darkvision 60 ft., tremorsense 60 ft., passive Perception 12
warwyrm.languages: Can't speak but understands commands in Sith

id-00001.name: Tunneler
id-00001.desc: The wyrm can burrow through solid rock at half its burrow speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

id-00002.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
id-00002.desc: If the wyrm fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

id-00003.name: Gargantuan Strength
id-00003.desc: The wyrm's melee weapon attacks are considered enhanced.

id-00004.name: Siege Monster
id-00004.desc: The wyrm deals double damage to objects and structures.

id-00005.name: Sith-born
id-00005.desc: Dark forcecasters and Sith (species) have advantage on Animal Handling checks against war wyrms.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The wyrm makes two attacks. one with its bite and one with its tail.

id-00002.name: Bite
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8+7) kinetic damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or be swallowed by the wyrm. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the wyrm, and it takes 21 (6d6) acid damage at the start of each of the wyrm's turns.\rIf the wyrm takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the wyrm must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the wyrm. If the wyrm dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

id-00003.name: Tail
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d6+7) kinetic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

id-00001.name: Options
id-00001.desc: The wyrm can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The wyrm regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

id-00002.name: Cloud of Dust
id-00002.desc: The wyrm lashes out and scatters a dusty wake. Each creature within 10 feet of the wyrm, including around a corner, must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the end of the wyrm's next turn. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw is immune to this effect until the end of the wyrm's next turn.

id-00003.name: Tail Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
id-00003.desc: The wyrm makes one tail attack.

id-00004.name: Move
id-00004.desc: The wyrm moves up to its speed.

id-00001.name: Flyby
id-00001.desc: The whisper bird doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

id-00002.name: Keen Sight
id-00002.desc: The whisper bird has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

id-00001.name: Talons
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 kinetic damage.

id-00001.name: Keen Hearing And Smell
id-00001.desc: The rat has advantage on on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing and smell.

id-00002.name: Pack Tactics
id-00002.desc: The rat has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if it is grappled by at least one of the rat's allies.

id-00001.name: Bite
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2d4 + 2) kinetic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or be grappled.

id-00001.name: Keen Hearing And Smell
id-00001.desc: The rat has advantage on on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing and smell.

id-00001.name: Bite
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) kinetic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

id-00001.name: Charge
id-00001.desc: If the woodoo moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a beak attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 11 (2d10) kinetic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The woodoo can make two attacks. one with its beak and one with its talons.

id-00002.name: Beak
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d10 + 4) kinetic damage.

id-00003.name: Talons
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 4) kinetic damage.

id-00004.name: Shriek (Recharge 6)
id-00004.desc: The woodoo lets out a deafening shriek in a 60-foot cone. All creatures that can hear it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 17 (5d6) sonic damage and is deafened for 1 minute. The creature can repeat this saving throw at end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself. On a success, a creature takes half damage and is not deafened.

id-00001.name: Stone Camouflage
id-00001.desc: The worrt has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

id-00001.name: Bite
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) kinetic damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 12). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the worrt can't bite another target. The target must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success.

id-00002.name: Tongue
id-00002.desc: The worrt targets one Small or smaller creature that it can see within 15 feet of it. The target must make a DC 12 Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pulled into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the worrt, and the worrt can make a bite attack against it as a bonus action.

id-00001.name: Stone Camouflage
id-00001.desc: The worrt has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in rocky terrain.

id-00001.name: Bite
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) kinetic damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the worrt can't bite another target. The target must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success.

id-00002.name: Swallow
id-00002.desc: The worrt makes a bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. On a hit, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the worrt, and it takes 14 (4d6) acid damage at the start of each of the worrt's turns. The worrt can have only one target swallowed at a time.\rIf the worrt dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting prone.

id-00001.name: Charge
id-00001.desc: If the Wraid moves at least 20 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a ram Attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 4 (2d8) kinetic damage.\rIf the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 10 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The Wraid makes two attacks, once with its ram and one with its claws.

id-00002.name: Ram
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (3d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

id-00003.name: Claws
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (2d4+3) kinetic damage.

wyyyschokk.name: Wyyyschokk
wyyyschokk.senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 11

id-00001.name: Pack Tactics
id-00001.desc: The wyyyschokk has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the wyyyschokk's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

id-00002.name: Spider Climb
id-00002.desc: The wyyyschokk can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

id-00003.name: Web Walker
id-00003.desc: The wyyyschokk ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

id-00001.name: Bite
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) kinetic damage, and the target must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target is stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining hit points, and is paralyzed while poisoned in this way.

id-00002.name: Web (Recharge 5-6)
id-00002.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing. As an action, the restrained target can make a DC 12 Strength check, bursting the webbing on a success. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

id-00001.name: Aggressive
id-00001.desc: As a bonus action, the zalaaca can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

id-00002.name: Keen Sight
id-00002.desc: The zalaaca has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The zalaaca can make two bite attacks.

id-00002.name: Bite
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) kinetic damage.

id-00001.name: Circuitry
id-00001.desc: The droid has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal ion or lightning damage.

id-00002.name: Security Protocol
id-00002.desc: The droid comes with proficiency in security and slicer tools.

id-00003.name: Interfaced Assistance Protocol
id-00003.desc: While you are interfaced with this droid via the tracker droid interface tech power, whenever you have advantage on an ability check or attack roll granted by the droid taking the Help action you can reroll one of the dice once.

id-00001.name: Shockprod
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 lightning damage.

id-00002.name: Sentry (1/day)
id-00002.desc: The Security Droid may enter a sentry state, granting the benefits of the alarm tech power to a target creature within 10 feet of the droid at the time of entering the sentry state. The Security Droid must remain within 60 feet of the warded location or the ability ends.

id-00001.name: Brute
id-00001.desc: A melee weapon does one extra die of damage when the wookiee hits with it (included in the attack).

id-00002.name: Precise Attacker
id-00002.desc: The wookiee's weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20. When the wookiee scores a critical hit, it rolls the damage dice three times, instead of twice.

id-00003.name: Surprise Attack
id-00003.desc: If the wookiee surprises a creature during the first round of combat, the wookiee has advantage on the first attack roll against that creature.\rIf the attack hits, it is considered a critical hit.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The wookiee makes two melee or two ranged weapon attacks.

id-00002.name: Vibroblade
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, one target. Hit.\r13 (2d8 + 4) kinetic damage or 15 (2d10 + 4) kinetic damage if wielded with two hands.

id-00003.name: Bowcaster
id-00003.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 40/160 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) energy damage.

id-00004.name: Bowcaster Burst
id-00004.desc: (Recharge 5-6) The wookiee sprays a 10foot-cube area within 40 ft. Each creature in the area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 9 (1d10 + 4) energy damage on a failed save.

id-00001.name: Aggressive
id-00001.desc: As a bonus action, the wookiee can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

id-00002.name: Reckless
id-00002.desc: At the start of its turn, the wookiee can can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

id-00003.name: Blood Rage
id-00003.desc: When a creature within 5 feet of the wookiee hits it with an attack, the wookiee may use its reaction to immediately make a melee weapon attack with advantage against that creature.

id-00001.name: Vibroaxe
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, one target. Hit: 9 (1d12 + 3) kinetic damage.

id-00001.name: Brute
id-00001.desc: A melee weapon does one extra die of damage when the wookiee hits with it (included in the attack).

id-00002.name: Berserk Charge
id-00002.desc: If the wookiee surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extar 7 (2d6) damage from the attack.

id-00003.name: Spellcasting
id-00003.desc: The wookiee engineer is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save DC 13, +5 to hit with spell attacks). The wookiee has 23 tech points. The wookiee engineer has the following spells prepared:\rCantrips (At will): electrical burst, mending, on/off\r1st level (23 slots): element of surprise, kolto pack, repair droid\r2nd level (23 slots): hold droid, overheat\r3rd level (23 slots): enhance weapon, fabricate trap

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The wookiee engineer makes two melee attacks.

id-00002.name: Vibromace
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, one target. Hit: 12 (2d10 + 3) kinetic damage.

autonomousservant.name: Autonomous Servant
autonomousservant.senses: blindsight 60 ft. (blind beyond this radius),passive Perception 10

id-00001.name: Tech Construct
id-00001.desc: Created with the Autonomous Servant tech power.

id-00002.name: Circuitry
id-00002.desc: The construct has disadvantage on saving throws against effects that would deal ion or lightning damage.

id-00001.name: Slam
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 5 (1d4 + 3) kinetic damage.

id-00001.name: Force Construct
id-00001.desc: Created with the Mass Animation force power.

id-00001.name: Strike
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 5 (1d4+3) kinetic damage.

id-00001.name: Force Construct
id-00001.desc: Created with the Mass Animation force power.

id-00001.name: Strike
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 5 (1d8+2) kinetic damage.

id-00001.name: Force Construct
id-00001.desc: Created with the Mass Animation force power.

id-00001.name: Strike
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 5 (2d6+1) kinetic damage.

id-00001.name: Force Construct
id-00001.desc: Created with the Mass Animation force power.

id-00001.name: Strike
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 5 (2d10+2) kinetic damage.

id-00001.name: Force Construct
id-00001.desc: Created with the Mass Animation force power.

id-00001.name: Strike
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit 5 (2d12+4) kinetic damage.

text.p: Jawas are easily identifiable by their traditional brown hooded robes, though it is not unheard of for them to wear other colors. Other notable features included their glowing yellow eyes, small stature and high pitched, quickly spoken language called Jawaese. Underneath their robes, Jawas appear to be gaunt, rodent-like creatures, with shrunken faces and yellow eyes.
Skin Color: Black
Hair Color: Black
Eye Color:Yellow
Distinctions: Diminutive stature, mechanical aptitude, thieving nature
Height: 2'9"+2d4"
Weight: 35 lb.+2d4 lb.
Homeworld: Tatooine
Homeworld: Tatooine
Language: Jawaese

Jawas are a communal, compulsive scavenger species who spend most of their life devoted to scavenging the deserts of Tatooine in search of any scrap metal, droid or mechanical part left behind from millennia of star travel and technological advancement. Most non-Jawas regard the Jawas as scavengers and thieves, a description that most Jawas actually find pleasing.

The Jawa's unofficial motto is *not to look for uses in a salvaged item, but rather to imagine someone else who might find a use for it.* This is evidenced in their endless search for wares with which to trade with almost any being Jawas encounter. They have a kind of instinctive feel for machinery and electronics, notorious for knowing how to get a piece of equipment functioning just well enough to sell.
Female Names: Bahimos, Kola, Levu, Rhovi, Uvet
Male Names: Dualda, Gradi, Tua, Valec, Winab
Surnames: Kkejenem, M'avoe, Tjoteelt, Wiamoel
Jawa Traits

abilityscoreincrease.name: Ability Score Increase
abilityscoreincrease.text: Your Dexterity score increases by 2, and your Intelligence score increases by 1.

age.name: Age
age.text: Jawas are considered adults when they make their first sale and live less than a century.

alignment.name: Alignment
alignment.text: Jawas tendency to steal and swindle causes them to tend towards the dark side, though there are exceptions.

size.name: Size
size.text: Jawas stand around 3 to 4 feet tall and weigh about 40 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Small.

speed.name: Speed
speed.text: Your base walking speed is 25 feet.

darkvision.name: Darkvision
darkvision.text:
You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
#!;Grovel, Cower, and Beg. As an action on your turn, you can cower pathetically to distract nearby foes. Until the end of your next turn, your allies gain advantage on attack rolls against enemies within 10 feet of you that can see you. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

techdabbler.name: Tech Dabbler
techdabbler.text: You know the *ion blast* at-will tech power. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the *repair droid* tech power once per day. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the *hold droid* tech power once per day. Intelligence is your techcasting ability for these powers. You do not require use of a wristpad for these powers.

thieves.name: Thieves
thieves.text: You are proficient in the Sleight of Hand skill.

tinker.name: Tinker
tinker.text: You have proficiency with artisan's tools (tinker's tools). You can use these and spend 1 hour and 100 cr worth of materials to construct a Tiny Device (AC 5, 1 hp). You can take the Use an Object action to have your device cause one of the following effects: create a small explosion, create a repeating loud noise for 1 minute, create smoke for 1 minute, cause a small electrical fire.\\nYou can maintain a number of these devices up to your proficiency bonus at once, and a device stops functioning after 24 hours away from you. You can dismantle the device to reclaim the materials used to create it.

languages.name: Languages
languages.text: You can speak, read, and write Jawaese. You can understand spoken and written Galactic Basic, but your vocal cords do not allow you to speak it. Jawaese blends quickly spoken, semi-meaningless syllables with scents to be understood.

text.p: Bith are craniopods with pale pink, yellow, or green skin, large heads, large lidless eyes, toeless feet, and long fingers. Their thumb and small finger were both fully opposable. The Bith's internal systems are different from most humanoids, as the Bith have only one lung, and exhale through their skin. Bith also lack a proper nose, instead having highly sensitive olfactory organs hidden in the skin-flaps of their cheeks.

The other Bith senses are also acute. Bith can sense the tonal qualities of sound as well as other species sensed colors. Their eyes, as big as a Menahuun's, can see microscopic details of nearby objects, but are extremely nearsighted as a result. An interesting side effect of their incredible sensors is the effect of sonic grenades, or screamers, on them. It is described as causing their heads to explode. Similarly, Bith have high manual dexterity which helps them manipulate fine tools, though their physical prowess with gross motor skills was only average.
Skin Color: Green, pink, white, or yellow
Hair Color: None
Eye Color:Black
Distinctions: Large cranium, acute senses of smell and hearing
Height: 4'9"+2d6"
Weight: 100 lb.x(2d4) lb.
Homeworld: Clak'dor VII
Language: Bith

Bith are one of the galaxy's most ancient civilizations, with a history going back millions of years. This antiquity garners respect in certain quarters, such as among the Gree, who gave them more respect than other, "younger" species. Their society is highly regimented, with everything from mate selection to political leadership controlled by sophisticated computer programs.
Bith names are quite diverse. Some names look complicated and difficult to pronounce, while others are quite simple.
Female Names: Duhia, F'hubama, R'hothal, Thidus
Male Names: Fedu, Jenkiss, Kabadons, Ph'teumkiass
Surnames: D'intes, Hern, K'sarorn, Nimum, Rumo
Bith Traits

abilityscoreincrease.name: Ability Score Increase
abilityscoreincrease.text: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Dexterity score increases by 1.

age.name: Age
age.text: Bith reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

alignment.name: Alignment
alignment.text: Biths' benevolent nature causes them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.

size.name: Size
size.text: Bith typically stand 5 to 6 feet tall and generally weigh about 120 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

speed.name: Speed
speed.text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

detailoriented.name: Detail Oriented
detailoriented.text: You are practiced at scouring for details. You have advantage on Intelligence (Investigation) checks within 5 feet.

keenhearingandsmell.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
keenhearingandsmell.text: You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that involve hearing or smell.

musician.name: Musician
musician.text: You are proficient in one musical instrument of your choice.

programmer.name: Programmer
programmer.text: Whenever you make an Intelligence (Technology) check related to computers, you are considered proficient in the Technology skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

languages.name: Languages
languages.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic, Bith, and one more language of your choice.

text.p: Sith are a proud and violent species of humanoids that evolved on Korriban, a planet within the Horuset system in an isolated Outer Rim region called the Stygian Caldera. Sith have a larger than average number of individuals with potential to use the Force in their species, so high in fact that the entire species was considered strongly Force-sensitive.
Sith Purebloods are characterized by their expressive facial appendages, bone spurs, cranial horns, and predatory gaze.
Skin Color: Black or red
Hair Color: Black, brown, gray, red, or white
Eye Color:Orange, red, or yellow
Distinctions: Tentacle facial appendages, often wear jewelry or have tattoos, bone spurs
Height: 4'8"+2d10"
Weight: 110 lb.x(2d4) lb.
Homeworld: Korriban
Language: Sith

Sith culture is a rigid and stratified caste-based society. For the Sith, war and violence are just as much a part of the natural order of life as peace or serenity. Though they are in an almost constant state of war, their civilization is quite sophisticated; they see these acts not as cruel or barbaric, but simply basic aspects of existence. Their constant warring led to a dwindling of the population on their original homeworld of Korriban as well as cultivated an intensely xenophobic society.

Sith Pureblood names are not conventional. They are often named for virtues in the Sith tongue. Sith rarely share surnames, since they do not value family ties. When a Sith Pureblood achieves a success or victory, they often change their name to match their perceived newfound status. Since force sensitivity is common in Sith Purebloods, and their culture is built around strength, most Sith are called simply "My Lord," or some other epithet, by their underlings.
Female Names: Aqurwia, Cliriu, Nupax, Ubhesosiuth
Male Names: Aqorzum, Khashai, Sihmot, Wirjol
Sith Pureblood Traits

abilityscoreincrease.name: Ability Score Increase
abilityscoreincrease.text: Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Strength or Dexterity score increases by 1.

age.name: Age
age.text: Sith reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

alignment.name: Alignment
alignment.text: The cruelty of the Sith causes them to tend toward chaotic dark side, though there are exceptions.

size.name: Size
size.text: Sith generally stand between 5 and 6 feet tall and weigh less than 200 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

speed.name: Speed
speed.text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

darkvision.name: Darkvision
darkvision.text: Your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

forcesensitive.name: Force Sensitive
forcesensitive.text: You know the *denounce* at-will force power. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the *curse* force power once per day. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the *darkness* force power once per day. Charisma is your forcecasting ability for these powers.

menacing.name: Menacing
menacing.text: You are proficient in the Intimidation skill.

sadistic.name: Sadistic
sadistic.text: You have proficiency with saberwhips, vibrowhips, and nets.

languages.name: Languages
languages.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Sith. Sith is an agglutinative language, in which words or even phrases were made up of linears sequences of distinct meaningful units.

text.p: The Mon Calamari are a bipedal, amphibious species with high-domed heads, webbed hands and large, goggle-like eyes. In addition to being webbed, the Mon Calamari hand presents three suction-cup like holes on its palm, and featured five claw-tipped fingers: one opposable thumb, two long middle fingers, and two very short outer fingers. Although they are shaped like flippers, their feet can nevertheless fit into boots designed for human-like feet. The females are distinguished from the males by their more prominent chest areas.
Skin Color: Reddish brown, brown, red, cyan, mottle, salmon, gold, blue, grey, or white
Hair Color: None
Eye Color:Yellow, orange, blue, or gray
Distinctions: Large, goggle-like eyes, high-domed heads, webbed hands
Height: 4'9"+2d8"
Weight: 100 lb.x(2d4) lb.
Homeworld: Mon Cala
Language: Mon Cal

The Mon Calamari have developed a very advanced and civilized culture. Their art, music, literature, and science show a creativity surpassed by few in the galaxy. Mon Calamari literature depicts stars as islands in a galactic sea, showing a passionate longing to explore space and discover other civilizations. Mon Calamari are both soft-spoken and gentle, slow to anger, and have the remarkable ability to maintain their concentration without being distracted by emotional responses. They are both inquisitive and creative, and have a near-legendary quality of being both determined and dedicated; once a Mon Calamari decides on a course of action, they are not easily swayed from that decision. They often fixate themselves on "lost causes."
Mon Calamari names generally have a melodic feel.
Female Names: Afwa, Lel, Mhirim, Ri, Theya
Male Names: Creaz, Fior, Hurneerth, Nurrins, Sielpa
Surnames: Dualda, Gradi, Tua, Valec, Winab
Mon Calamari Traits

abilityscoreincrease.name: Ability Score Increase
abilityscoreincrease.text: Your Charisma score increases by 2, and your Intelligence or Wisdom score increases by 1.

age.name: Age
age.text: Mon Calamari reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

alignment.name: Alignment
alignment.text: Mon Calamaris' love of the arts cause them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.

size.name: Size
size.text: Mon Calamari stand between 5 and 6 feet tall and rarely weigh more than 150 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

speed.name: Speed
speed.text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

amphibious.name: Amphibious
amphibious.text: You can breathe air and water.

darkvision.name: Darkvision
darkvision.text: Accustomed to life underwater, you have superior vision in low light conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

moncalamariresistance.name: Mon Calamari Resistance
moncalamariresistance.text: You have advantage on saving throws against slow effects and you have resistance against cold damage (explained in chapter 9).

musical.name: Musical
musical.text: You have proficiency in one musical instrument of your choice.

swim.name: Swim
swim.text: You have a swimming speed of 30 feet.

languages.name: Languages
languages.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic, Mon Cal, and one language of your choice.

text.p: Togruta have rusty skin tones ranging in hue from blue to red to green, with white pigmentation on their faces, greyish lips, and white stripes adorn various parts of their bodies. The pattern of stripes varies from individual to individual. This red and white pattern was a phenotype left over from their ancestor's camouflage that helped them to blend in with Shili's natural surroundings.

Their heads bear two montrals, with three to four head-tails, whose stripes were darker than those of the montrals. Togruta have the ability to sense the proximity and movement of physical objects around them by means of their hollow montrals, which detect space ultrasonically. Young Togrutas' montrals and posterior head-tail do not fully grow until adolescence, when their montrals curve and their final head-tail grows to the length of their other head-tails.
Skin Color: Blue, green, orange, purple, red, white, or yellow
Hair Color: None
Eye Color:Black, blue, green, orange, purple, yellow, or red
Distinctions: Sharp canine teeth, two montrals, three or four head-tails
Height: 4'9"+2d8"
Weight: 115 lb.x(2d4) lb.
Homeworld: Shili
Language: Togruti

Togruta have a strong sense of unity and togetherness. On their native homeworld of Shili, they rely on each other and band together to take a stand against the massive monsters that hunt them. The creatures of Shili most often attack in groups, which was even more reason for the native Togruta to work together. While most of Shili is covered in the scrublands where the Togruta hunt their herbivorous prey, the Togruta live in small communities in the forest valleys.
Togruta names are typically long. Surnames are familial.
Female Names: Akoma, Maasha, Okohlo, Shola
Male Names: Acanaar, Mukraas, Obolak, Tokrym
Surnames: Hyl, Na, Nim, Ris, Resh, Vaal, Zin
Togruta Traits

abilityscoreincrease.name: Ability Score Increase
abilityscoreincrease.text: Your Wisdom score increases by 2, and your Strength or Dexterity score increases by 1.

age.name: Age
age.text: Togruta reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

alignment.name: Alignment
alignment.text: Togruta culture focuses on unity which causes them to tend toward the light side, though there are exceptions.

size.name: Size
size.text: Togruta typically stand between 5 and 6 feet tall and weigh 150 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

speed.name: Speed
speed.text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

darkvision.name: Darkvision
darkvision.text: Your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

montralreception.name: Montral Reception
montralreception.text: You have tremorsense out to 30 feet. You can detect and pinpoint the origin of vibrations within a specific radius, provided that monster and the source of the vibrations are in contact with the same ground or substance. Tremorsense can't be used to detect flying or incorporeal creatures

wildhunters.name: Wild Hunters
wildhunters.text: You are proficient in the Survival skill.

languages.name: Languages
languages.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Togruti. Togruti is an ornate language characterized by trills and long vowel sounds which are modified by subtle tremors in the Togruta's head-tails. This language is heavily influenced by Basic, but also incorporates some native idioms, which caused Basic-speaking Togruta to use seemingly strange expressions.

text.p: Trandoshans are a large, bipedal sentient species, with scaly skin which was shed roughly once every standard year and was thought to be very durable. Cold-blooded reptiles, Trandoshans had two super-sensitive varied color eyes with horizontal black pupils, which could see far into the infrared range. Each of their four limbs ends in three razor sharp claws. These are perfect for combat, but did not grant them manual dexterity, making a Trandoshan's finger movements somewhat clumsy and awkward.
Skin Color: Green, yellow, brown, orange, red
Hair Color: None
Eye Color:Yellow, orange
Distinctions: Reptilian, scaly skin, regenerative properties
Height: 5'5"+2d12"
Weight: 130 lb.x(2d6) lb.
Homeworld: Trandosha
Language: Dosh

Trandoshans worship their goddess, the Scorekeeper, whom they would appease through acts which increased their Jagannath points. This is done by living a lifestyle which was, by non-Trandoshan standards, overtly aggressive, leading many Trandoshans to become bounty hunters, mercenaries, or slavers. Trandoshans especially prize Wookiee pelts, which consequently play a large part in earning Jagannath points-capturing the pelts of particularly infamous Wookiees would give the hunter a large increase in Jagganath points. To be shamed or captured during a hunt would zero one's Jagganath points-effectively making their life forfeit in the eyes of the Scorekeeper. They could, however, win all those points back by killing the one who zeroed their score.

Trandoshan names are quite harsh and contain a lot of elongated sounds, as well as a lot of s's. Differences between male and female names are often very subtle, but there is a higher chance for female names to contain softer sounds.
Female Names: Aksa, Idwiks, Kluks, Mezuus, Shokss
Male Names: Bossk, Tshyrrng, Varrsk, Wuikkekss
Surnames: Dallosss, Druc, Groqisch, Hsac, Nausdot
Trandoshan Traits

abilityscoreincrease.name: Ability Score Increase
abilityscoreincrease.text: Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

age.name: Age
age.text: Trandoshans reach adulthood in their early teens and rarely live to be older than 70.

alignment.name: Alignment
alignment.text: Trandoshans tend toward the dark side, though there are exceptions.

size.name: Size
size.text: Trandoshans stand as tall as 7 and a half feet and can weigh over 300 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

speed.name: Speed
speed.text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

darkvision.name: Darkvision
darkvision.text: Your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

holdbreath.name: Hold Breath
holdbreath.text: You can hold your breath for up to 15 minutes at a time.

regenerative.name: Regenerative
regenerative.text: When you take damage, you can use your reaction and expend a hit die to regain health as long as the damage would not reduce your hit points to 0.

savingface.name: Saving Face
savingface.text: Trandoshans are careful not to show weakness in front of their allies, for fear of losing status. If you miss with an attack roll or fail an ability check or a saving throw, you can gain a bonus to the roll equal to the number of allies you can see within 30 feet of you (maximum bonus of +5). Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

languages.name: Languages
languages.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Dosh. Dosh is characterized by its harsh grunts, hisses and growls, and its written form that used alphabetic glyphs.

text.p: The Chiss are a near-Human species distinguished by their blue skin and glowing red eyes. Genetic analysis indicate that they are an offshoot of humanity, and it is believed that moving underground led to a divergence between them and baseline Humans. Their blue skin, jet black hair and red eyes generally command attention; these features make them physically striking and instantly recognizable.
Skin Color: Blue or silver
Hair Color: Black, blue, or silver
Eye Color:Red
Distinctions: Glowing red eyes, above-average night vision
Weight: 110 lb.x(2d4) lb.
Homeworld: Csilla
Language: Cheunh

Chiss society is highly structured and ordered with the rule of law being enforced by a group of four affiliations known as the Ruling Families: the Csapla, Nuruodo, Inrokini and Sabosen. These are not biological family groupings but instead different branches of their government. Every Chiss claims affiliation to one of the four families, as determined by both tradition and place of birth. The family names are more of a cultural holdover; the bloodlines had grown so co-meddled that any Chiss could claim affiliation to any of the ruling families. In spite of the outward impression of calm and order that the Chiss like to project to outsiders, there were evidently tensions within the Families; political assassinations are a real part of Chiss political life for the Ruling Families.

A Chiss true-name has 3 parts, each separated by an apostrophe. The first part is their family name, the second part is their root name, and the third part is their occupation. Chiss rarely share their true-name with non-Chiss, and usually go by their root name. Male and female names do not significantly deviate.
Chiss Traits

abilityscoreincrease.name: Ability Score Increase
abilityscoreincrease.text: Your Intelligence score increases by 2, and your Charisma score increases by 1.

age.name: Age
age.text: Chiss reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

alignment.name: Alignment
alignment.text: Chiss' tactical and selfish nature cause them to tend toward lawful dark side, though there are exceptions.

size.name: Size
size.text: Chiss typically stand between 5 and 6 feet tall and weigh about 160 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

speed.name: Speed
speed.text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

techresistance.name: Tech Resistance
techresistance.text: Growing up around technology leaves an impact on Chiss. You have advantage on saving throws against tech powers.

darkvision.name: Darkvision
darkvision.text: You have a keen eyesight, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

martialproficiency.name: Martial Proficiency
martialproficiency.text: You have proficiency with light and medium armor as well as the blaster pistol and sniper rifle.

languages.name: Languages
languages.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Cheunh. Cheunh is a complex language that is difficult for non-Chiss to learn. Chiss take pride in this difficulty.

text.p: Zabrak are Near-Human, but have a number of significant physical characteristics that set them apart from baseline Humanity. The most striking of these are a series of vestigial horns that crown the heads of both males and females. These horns grow at puberty in varying patterns and signified that their rite of passage is drawing near.

In addition to their horns, another of the traits that make Zabrak instantly recognizable are their facial tattoos, which are made up of thin lines received during their rite of passage. These could symbolize many things, including but not limited to family lineage, place of birth, or even a design that reflected their individual personalities.
Lastly, Zabraks possess a second heart.
Skin Color: Pale to dark brown, red, orange and yellow
Hair Color: Black, blonde, brown, red, or purple
Eye Color:Yellow, green, orange, brown, blue, red, or purple
Distinctions: Horns, two hearts, facial tattoos
Height: 5'1"+2d12"
Weight: 120 lb.x(2d4) lb.
Homeworld: Iridonia or Dathomir
Language: Zabraki

Zabrak are often seen by most other species as being single-minded, an observation that is not terribly incorrect. This single-minded determination comes from the fact that they are a species with a strong sense of self-assuredness, confident that they are able to accomplish any task that they set out to do. However, this does not lead a Zabrak to develop a sense of prideful superiority towards others. Though it is not uncommon to see competition between colonies, this is not seen as a negative. The Zabraks believe that the various experiences of the different colonies only serve to add to the species's overall value throughout the galaxy.
Zabrak names are usually derived from the animals living on their planet. Zabraks don't use surnames.
Female Names: Blostopa, Mega, Novrar, Rebroke
Male Names: Kadro, Muraa, Neqama, Ruvroo, Xadra
Zabrak Traits

abilityscoreincrease.name: Ability Score Increase
abilityscoreincrease.text: Your Constitution score increases by 2, and your Strength or Dexterity score increases by 1.

age.name: Age
age.text: Zabraks reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

alignment.name: Alignment
alignment.text: Zabraks tend toward no particular alignment. The best and worst are found among them.

size.name: Size
size.text: Zabraks stand anywhere from 5 to 7 feet tall and weigh up to 300 lbs. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

speed.name: Speed
speed.text: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

coercive.name: Coercive
coercive.text: You have proficiency with Persuasion or Intimidation (your choice).

crafters.name: Crafters
crafters.text: You have proficiency with with one artisan's tool of your choice.

darkvision.name: Darkvision
darkvision.text: Your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

secondheart.name: Second Heart
secondheart.text: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

unarmedcombatant.name: Unarmed Combatant
unarmedcombatant.text: Your unarmed strikes deal 1d4 kinetic damage. You can use your choice of your Strength or Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls. You must use the same modifier for both rolls.

languages.name: Languages
languages.text: You can speak, read, and write Galactic Basic and Zabraki.

text.p: Twi'leks are usually thin, although corpulent individuals were known to exist. Twi'leks are omnivores; this diet is essential given that food is scarce on their homeworld, Ryloth. Twi'leks possess multiple stomachs, an unusual trait that enables them to eat almost any food. When traveling off their homeworld, Twi'leks rarely refused food, which frequently leads to obesity among starfarers. Twi'lek society also associates obesity as a sign of affluence and success.
Skin Color: Blue, brown, dark grey, green, orange, pink, purple, red, tan, teal, white, yellow, or striped
Hair Color: None
Eye Color:Black, blue, brown, green, hazel, orange, pink, purple, or yellow
Distinctions: Lekku, sharp claw-like nails, males often file their teeth to points
Height: 5'3"+2d12"
Weight: 125 lb.x(2d4) lb.
Homeworld: Ryloth
Language: Twi'leki

The natural grace and exotic beauty of the female Twi'leks make them a popular target among slave traders. Slavery is the main currency of Ryloth. Some see it as a chance to make money by kidnapping or selling orphaned children, while others see slavery as a way of saving children from growing up in Ryloth's harsh environment. A number of Twi'leks believe that slavery is an efficient way to proliferate their species and preserve their culture, as the Twi'leks lack their own means of inter-planetary travel. Regardless of how it came about, many Twi'leks live as slaves or entertainers and are considered status symbols, especially the females of rarer skin hues. Twi'leks that manage to escape from captivity usually turned to a life of thievery or prostitution, with both genders making use of their powers of seduction.
Twi'lek names combine their first name and a clan name into a single name, rather than having a separate surname.
Female Names: Arag'mure, Oanicfuba, Unaecripi
Male Names: Ecrizsati, Gaj'mogos, Ukelweko
Twi'lek Traits
